name: Agent Orange
description: Don’t let the name scare you! The only herbicidal warfare Agent Orange will wage is between the excellence of this strain's flavors and uplifting effects. A well-balanced hybrid that combines the smooth Orange Velvet with the bold Jack the Ripper, Agent Orange will capture your senses. Wonderful smells of oranges and fresh-cut citrus fruit will entice you immediately, while the pigments of deep maroon and purple will make this bud stand out in a sea of green. The effects are uplifting and motivating, serving as a great mood enhancer if you are feeling lethargic or depressed.
descriptionPlain: Don’t let the name scare you! The only herbicidal warfare Agent Orange will wage is between the excellence of this strain's flavors and uplifting effects. A well-balanced hybrid that combines the smooth Orange Velvet with the bold Jack the Ripper, Agent Orange will capture your senses. Wonderful smells of oranges and fresh-cut citrus fruit will entice you immediately, while the pigments of deep maroon and purple will make this bud stand out in a sea of green. The effects are uplifting and motivating, serving as a great mood enhancer if you are feeling lethargic or depressed.

highlightedReviews.text:
People always talk about taste and smell and shit on here, and that stuff is okay, but the REASON you smoke is for the high, so that's all I'm gonna talk about.

Agent Orange, at least the one I got, is straight 50/50, and you feel that, too. You're thinking deep thoughts and laughing about it, all the while riding on a magic carpet ride that is your body. Great for dulling pain.

This was the first thing I smoked after not smoking for 1.5 months, and it was just what I wanted. Recommended if you want the best of both indica and sativa worlds.

I’ve had this app for a while now and I’ve never wanted to write a review except for NOW. This is an amazing clear headed high. I was able to play outside and drive after smoking this. Super light feeling and lots of laughs. It has my thoughts going, but nothing too overwhelming. This is a lot smoother than fortune cookies and sour power pack. If you like granddaddy purple this is it’s exciting opposite. Love love love it.

articles.title: Leafly Staff Picks: Cannabis Strains and Products for Cozy Fall Days
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Fall is here, and many of us are waving goodbye to summer with smiling, pumpkin spice-stained faces stuffed into scarves. The new season not only inspires a change in wardrobe, but often a change in our stash boxes. These cannabis strains and products are known to fuel the cozy feels as the days get darker, leaves turn, and rain speckles the sidewalks outside. So load up, snuggle up, and smoke up, because fall is finally here.
1. Jack Herer
(Leafly)
Sativa-dominant Jack Herer is a strain for all seasons, but this sweet, pine-scented bud is especially well-suited for autumn. The warm, spicy flavor fills the body with a comfy, cozy sensation throughout every limb while wrapping the mind in a blissful blanket. And for those mourning the loss of long summer days, Jack Herer offers a comforting hand to help pull you from low moods.

2. Infused Syrups
(Courtesy of Craft Elixirs)
What’s better than a hot drink on a windy fall morning? Cannabis-infused hot drinks, obviously. Infused syrups are hitting the market with ferocity, blessing our mugs with the gift of enhanced flavor and effect. Add Craft Elixirs’ CBD Ginger to your green tea for feelings of clean relaxation that lets you stay productive and stress-free, or find an infused maple syrup to add to your morning latte. Or, simply make infused syrup yourself by following this recipe.

3. Agent Orange
(Leafly)
With an invigorating citrus flavor that warms both mind and body, Agent Orange is a versatile hybrid strain that perfectly accompanies hobbies both relaxing and active. Take Agent Orange out on an autumn hike and watch as its euphoric veil enhances the red, yellow, and orange colors around you. Puff on this one while stuck inside on a rainy day, giving yourself permission to relax with some video games or a new show. Agent Orange also brings out the best flavors in chai tea, a hot toddy, or a cinnamon hot chocolate.

4. Pre-Rolled Joints

Few pleasures match the feeling of walking through an orange-hued forest with a joint in-hand. Whether you never learned how to roll a joint or feel pressured to spend every available second appreciating the fleeting colors of fall, pre-rolls make a convenient mobile choice. Numerous pre-roll options await you, but my favorite remains the Saints variety pack from Seattle Green Bud. (More Leafly staff favorites can be found here.)

5. Vanilla Kush
(Leafly)
Vanilla Kush is a cozy indica staple that delivers autumn vibes with a toasty vanilla flavor that sits underneath warm, earthy overtones. Bringing a gentle euphoric hum to the mind while letting muscles sink like dead weight into blankets, use this indica to cozy up with a book or movie, or let it guide you into a well-deserved nap on a rainy weekend.

6. Infused Bath Bombs
(Julia Sumpter/Leafly)
As temperatures drop outside, the urge to dip into a steaming bathtub gets hard to fight. Light a few candles, turn on some relaxing music, and sink into a hot spring sizzling with cannabis. You can take a lovely cannabis-infused bath thanks to magical bath soaks like those from Cannabis Basics, Mary Jane’s Medicinals, and other favorites. Does your local dispensary not carry bath products? Just make your own bath bombs with this recipe.

articles.title: Tips for Growing Agent Orange Cannabis
articles.author: Leafly Staff
articles.text:
Ever wanted to grow your favorite strain? Leafly and General Hydroponics are teaming up on a series of grow guides that will equip you with all the tips and tricks you need to grow different strains successfully.

Strain Overview: Agent Orange offers a quality, uplifting high and a powerful citrus aroma that allows the mind and body to relax. A cross of Orange Velvet and Jack the Ripper, Agent Orange was produced by Subcool at TGA Genetics.
Grow Techniques: Top and train heavily to help this plant produce a bushy shape. The more leads you can get, the higher your yields. It grows well in all mediums, but thrives in big pots in outdoor Northern California. Make sure the buds are supported; otherwise they’ll break the branches.
Flowering Time: 7-9 weeks
Yield: High
Grow Difficulty: Moderate
Climate: This plant does best if kept between 68-80 degrees Fahrenheit. Agent Orange does great in the California sun, especially with warm nights.
Indoor/Outdoor: Agent Orange will take off outdoors and grow into beautiful large plants. It also trains well indoors, either hydroponically or in soil.
Feeding: When growing in soil, have your giant pots amended and filled with nutrients long before your plants go in the ground. Strive for a healthy mixture of chicken manure, worm castings, perlite, and other quality soil amenders.
